page.title: 17Uckington Village Survey
page.content: Uckington is situated on the A4019 better known as the Tewkesbury road. It is a quiet village with about 20 houses.It has two telephone boxes,one church and a village hall.Most people like the area because it is peaceful. Most people own a car because the village is quite far from any shops, post offices and super markets.There is a bus service twice a week to and from Cheltenham.It is a poor service because often it is late or doesn't even turn up.The children go to school in Cheltenham or Bishops Cleave. There are a lot of farms which surround the village. Most have big barns with hay in. A Forge is in Uckington.The Forge sells and makes products like garden gates and fire grates.Most of the work is hand made.
